content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu.Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť príkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si potom cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO profilu Thunderbirdu - zvolte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.

Does this explain it sufficiently?
creator: jgh0000

content: It still is not clear. If this is an IMAP account, the messages are not backed up unless you copy them to a local folder nad have spot checked to ensure you have complete messages, not just headers. Otherwise, the messages on PC are just copies of originals and, if deleted onlline, they're also deleted on PC. If you want to keep messages on PC, and delete from online, I suggest - check account settings>synchronization&storage advanced tab to verify that the folders can be accessed offline - then, click File>offline>download to ensure that all message content is downloaded. - then, create a Local Folder and copy the desired messages for keeping to the Local Folder - then, you can delete the Gmail copies. - at this point, those messages exist only on the PC, so be sure to do occasional backup of profile.
creator: davidsk

content:
It works fine here, for plain text and html messages. Setting mailnews.wraplength to 0 (zero) in Config. editor makes plain text messages wrap to the window width. HTML wraps to the width automatically.

Does the same thing happen in safe/troubleshoot mode (hold Shift when launching TB)?

I created a new profile for 128, as I do with every major release. Are you using a profile from an older version? Creating a new profile with 128 is recommended over trying to downgrade to 115. Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, to create and manage profiles.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Thank you, sfhowes, for your reply.

I've tried starting in safe mode but the problem persists even then. I've tried clearing the cache, no difference. The odd thing is that the problem is affecting two different computers, admittedly in the same house but not networked together. We have a slightly dodgy internet connection over 4G - could that have anything to do with it? We're also in France, is this in any way relevant?

Setting the mailnews.wraplength to 0 made no difference to either plain text or HTML.

I've never created or changed a profile; the one I seem to be using is called default-release and, looking at the dates in the folder, it is a profile that is indeed several years old. Could you please tell me why creating a new profile will change how the text wraps? Should I be changing settings (and if so, which ones?) in the new profile? Sorry, but this is uncharted territory for me and I don't know what I'm doing here.
creator: carolineswebstuff

content:
I can't say exactly why it's not working for you, but I don't think the connection type or locale matters. But I'm pretty sure it will work in a new profile, and it will be much quicker than trying to debug your current profile, even if you haven't dealt with profiles before. In theory, updating TB with the previous profile should be seamless, but in practice there are often old files and settings that hamper the migration. An example.

Open the Help/Troubleshooting Info tab, click about:profiles, create a new profile and give it a name, then add an account and see if wrapping works properly. Change the mailnews.wraplength preference in the new profile for plain text wrapping.

The old profile is unaffected and can be opened as before or from about:profiles. If the new profile works, local mail, address books etc. can be copied from the old to the new. IMAP accounts, network calendars and contacts will sync with the mail server after being added to the new profile.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Thank you so much, sfhowes, for your help. I have now created a new profile, set the wraplength to 0 and unfortunately it has made no difference.

This is all very peculiar... where do I go from here?
creator: carolineswebstuff

content:
There is no shortage of posts about wrapping issues, as a web search shows. But I can't find any that point to a sure solution in this case. An earlier topic suggests adding a preference in Config. editor. Open the editor and paste mail.compose.wrap_to_window_width into the search box. Since the pref. isn't there by default, click the + icon to add it as a Boolean with the value true. This pref. existed in old versions, but was removed due to it causing other problems. I would be (pleasantly) surprised if it helps.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1161310

I also wonder if you have an external app like CCleaner that resets preferences in apps like TB to override manual settings.
creator: sfhowes

content:
That was a brilliant thought, sfhowes; I had high hopes for this one... sadly, it did not work. And no, I don't have CCleaner or anything like that. Since I moved to Windows 10 I've let Windows deal with cleaning the registry.

I'm starting to think that I'm going to have to to uninstall TB on both computers and re-install from scratch, which is a bit of a nuisance. Unless you have any further ideas?

Thank you so much for keeping on trying to help me with this problem!
creator: carolineswebstuff

content:
The following code works in 128 (see picture): 

#threadTree[rows="thread-card"] .card-container {     color: var(--tag-color); }

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the number as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

Did you toggle the stylesheets preference?
creator: sfhowes

content: Thank you for your advice. After toggling the `toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets` to `true`, the configuration takes effect properly.
creator: charlee.ch

content:
This was extremely useful!

I wanted only the subject text to be highlighted, so I ended up using: 

#threadTree[rows="thread-card"] .card-container .thread-card-subject-container {    color: var(--tag-color);

}

content:
I thought it was just me. Last month I set up an on premise test IMAP server, and was able to connect Thunderbird with no issues.

A month later I move that VM to a different location, and was not able to connect Thunderbird. I thought maybe it was something to do with moving it to a different location/subnet, so I stood up brand new IMAP server.

Still no luck connecting Thunderbird. If I run a test, I get the green checkmark, but if I click 'Done', I get Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password.

Server side, the message I get is "Connection closed: terminating connection", which generally indicates client side issue.

I ran some wireshark on the server side and client side. Server side, I get (placeholders in x): 695 10.673646 192.168.x.me 192.168.x.server TLSv1.2 85 Encrypted Alert

Client side, I get: 824 9.293752 192.168.x.me 192.168.x.server SMTP 87 C: EHLO we-guess.mozilla.org | QUIT 825 9.307994 192.168.x.server 192.168.x.me TCP 60 25 → 65034 [ACK] Seq=109 Ack=34 Win=32735 Len=0 827 9.323814 192.168.x.server 192.168.x.me SMTP 99 S: 501 Syntax error in parameters or arguments

1045 13.690488 192.168.x.me 192.168.x.server TLSv1.2 85 Encrypted Alert 1046 13.690509 192.168.x.me 192.168.x.server TCP 54 65035 → 143 [FIN, ACK] Seq=1029 Ack=1369 Win=261376 Len=0 (This frame initiates the connection closing).

Do you have two-step verification on the account? If so, disable it and enter the account (not app) password in the OAuth window.

content: Gmail IMAP accounts automatically copy sent messages to Sent Mail, so this is the folder that should be subscribed, and 'Place a copy in' in the Copies & Folders section of Account Settings should be unchecked. That will also disable the 'Place replies in the folder of the message being replied to' setting.

content:
QuickBooks Error PS038 typically occurs during payroll updates and usually indicates a problem with the payroll subscription or connectivity. To resolve this issue, follow these steps:

  • Verify Subscription: Ensure your QuickBooks payroll subscription is active. Check this by logging into your Intuit account or within QuickBooks.
  • Check Internet Connection: Make sure your internet connection is stable and reliable, as poor connectivity can hinder payroll updates.
  • Update QuickBooks: Ensure QuickBooks is updated to the latest version. Go to Help > Update QuickBooks Desktop and download any available updates.
  • Restart QuickBooks: Close and reopen QuickBooks to clear any temporary glitches.
  • Run QuickBooks File Doctor: Use the QuickBooks File Doctor tool to diagnose and fix network or company file issues.
  • Contact Support: If the issue persists, call QuickBooks support at {I8oo}_845_9666 for further assistance, providing details of the error and any troubleshooting steps taken.

content: The prompt is asking for your Windows account user name and password. 'More choices' will include a PIN or biometric scan if you have it set up. The prompt can be disabled in Settings/Privacy & Security/Passwords, 'Require device sign in...', but to do so will require filling in the prompt once.
creator: sfhowes

content: When you uncheck the setting to require sign in, you will be prompted to enter your Windows user account user name and password. After that, you won't be asked when viewing the TB passwords.
